title: Mobile-Based COVID-19 Vaccine Efficacy Analysis Modeling Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational statistics, understanding of SIR (Susceptible-Infected-Recovered) infectious disease transmission models, and basic Python programming
context.additional_context: A process analyzing the epidemiological impact of vaccines through data-driven modeling practice in a microlearning environment conducted exclusively via smartphones

learning_goals: The impact of vaccination rates on infection curves can be simulated using a modified SIR model.
Develop an analytical framework applying machine learning models to predict differences in vaccine efficacy across countries
Interpret vaccine impact analysis results using Python-based data visualization tools (e.g., Plotly) in mobile environments

resources: Mobile app compatible with Google Colab
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
